website_summaries.verdict: High-quality wheelchair for extra-large dogs, with multiple sizes available for a perfect fit, but it's pricey.
pros: Will fit dogs weighing between 70 and 180 pounds, so it can accommodate large dogs
To obtain the right fit, five sizes are available, depending on the rear leg length
Harnesses are adjustable for best fit
cons: Contains more plastic in the frame than is desirable

customer_reviews.title: DM Doggie Happy to be Mobile Again!! Thank You!!
customer_reviews.text: We were VERY skeptical that our 70 lb female German Shepherd would be any bit interested in a wheel chair. She was diagnosed with Degenerative Myeliopathy 2 months ago and it was progressing quickly. Heartbroken that our 10 yr old pup was accelerating into full-on mobile disability; and with the help of the best holistic vet on the planet, we got the wheels. Our sassy pup LOVES them. She can poop and pee in her wheels, she can still chase the bunnies, and she is much happier to be Ms. Independent trailblazing through the forest, instead of us holding her back end up with a harness every where she goes. For such skeptics, we are beyond elated with our purchase.
customer_reviews.author: The PAK

customer_reviews.title: Not a Happy Customer!
customer_reviews.text: Parts of this product are made of cheap plastic material which caused my senior dog to fall on his face when I buckled him in (the plastic buckle broke off). I got a REALLY hard time from the company when I requested a refund and they made it almost impossible (I spoke to three people and the only nice and helpful person was Jamie). I returned the product and am hoping I'll get a full refund asap.
customer_reviews.author: Ana S.

customer_reviews.title: Easy transition for me and my dog!
customer_reviews.text: These wheels gave my dog his mobility back for our walks! Due to a degenerative disorder, Bugsy (75 lbs.) is losing the use of his back legs. These wheels are perfect to be able to walk him again. They were easy to put together and adjust. Bugsy adjusted to them quickly too! The only issue I've had is with the straps that hold up the back feet. They dont stay put all that well. Other than that this is a great product and I recommend it for any dog with mobility issues!
customer_reviews.author: Adrienne Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Seems nice of it fits your dog properly
customer_reviews.text: Did not fit my dog according to appropriate measurements. I have an English mastiff, weighing about 140 lbs and got the xxl size wheelchair. Staff was helpful with the return and answered promptly, however, charged a 20 percent restocking fee (which it does say you will be charged prior to completing the order) plus you have to pay to ship it back which was about another 40 dollars just in shipping costs. This product did seem quite durable if my dog was able to use it. Your dog will not be able to sit using this product, which I find as a downfall as well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased with the Doggie Wheelchair
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised. Very well designed, easy to assemble in about 20 minutes and very easy to adjust even when strapped to your friend. Our dog, 80# Boxer, showed minimal resistance to using it at first, but quickly seemed to enjoy increased independent mobility. I can see why the used market is pretty good for these, looks like it will hold up well. Dog can relieve itself while harnessed, as advertised. Only down side was the exterior axle nuts are somewhat exposed and can scratch furniture or other objects if dog walks around unsupervised.
customer_reviews.author: Dave E

customer_reviews.title: I loved it i still have it just dont have the ...
customer_reviews.text: I loved it i still have it just dont have the big boy that i bought it for. But I want everyone to know that it gave him the best year of his life i know they are expensive i do but the jpy it brought my old running buddy that last year of his life was priceless. if i could get a video of him on here i would. super light weight easy to assemble and store. i used to strap it on the top of my jeep and take him everywhere
customer_reviews.author: amy lynn cantrell

customer_reviews.title: this is not for handicap dogs
customer_reviews.text: My dog can still walk but it is very hard for him. this product did not help. instead of the weight being taken on by the wheelchair it seems to just distribute it to the front legs which did not make him comfortable and caused him to want to collapse. This product is for more mobile younger dogs. on a side note be very careful when purchasing. we got a refund but not the full amount. For some reason they are not refunding about $100. This is not the tax it's $100 off the amount.
customer_reviews.author: McFarley

customer_reviews.title: I would spend a little more and have one custom built
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my aging but otherwise very active gsd who has DM. All i can say is. I wished i would have bought an eddies wheels and paid little more money. This one..although i think its well built has been hard to adjust and get it comfortable for my dog. We have adjusted this..adjusted that..over and over..and not only does he not like it..but his legs have gotten worse since using it. Is frustrating. I just wish i would have had one custom built to suit his body and disability. Then i would know for sure that its comfortable for him because i know he would be taking off..he wants to play so bad.
customer_reviews.author: shawn lebaron

customer_reviews.title: wheels for dogs
customer_reviews.text: I brought these wheels and it didn't work for my dog, who I had to put to sleep. Therefore I returned it. . I was not given my full refund of $486.92. I was given $351.00. I called handicaps and they refunded me yesterday $126.73. I figured amazon shortened me the tax i paid of $9.19.. So I only lost $9.19 , my tax money. Thanks, I wish Amazon would give me the rest of my tax money $9.19. That's better than loosing $135.92.
customer_reviews.author: Paula E. Rogers

customer_reviews.title: Not happy with this!!!
customer_reviews.text: Not happy with the product. My great dane twisted himself twice into this contraption. Those little straps to hold up his back legs are not working, and way not strong enough. Not happy with the company either as they charge a 20% restocking fee.
customer_reviews.author: C Binnie

customer_reviews.title: Can not Recommend This one
customer_reviews.text: I almost never give a negative review, but this wheelchair was far too heavy for my dog, too difficult to put together, the wheels did not fit properly, and the construction was shotty.
customer_reviews.author: S. Newby

customer_reviews.title: Worth every dime!!!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this. At first I was worried that it wouldn't work as well as I wanted to and with the price being high, I didn't want it to not work well. I decided to take a flyer on this one because I want my pup to be happy again. This product exceeded all my expectations. I could not have been happier. Even though the price is so high, it was so worth seeing my dog so happy again. Just a bit of info, I have a boxer that is about 75lbs. She can pee and poop while in her chair and rarely gets touched by either in the process
customer_reviews.author: Christopher G.

customer_reviews.title: Quality product for the money
customer_reviews.text: I wish I had longer to use this product but unfortunately my beautiful Bordeaux passed soon after the cart arrived. It was very easy to use and very stable. It was also quite simple to adjust for my pet. I'm sure it would have been a great investment had my pup lived longer to use it
customer_reviews.author: Mia2424

customer_reviews.title: Expensive, but soooo worth it!
customer_reviews.text: We have a 70 lb dog; his back legs and hips don’t work so well anymore. This device albeit expensive was worth every penny. Our dog loves it!
customer_reviews.author: Michele

customer_reviews.title: Wagging tails and happy hearts ♥️
customer_reviews.text: My German Shepherd is 13 years old. The breed is prone to hip dysplasia. He woke up with loss of mobility. Loving parents we ordered the sturdiest walker we could find. Took a minute to master but the video was his first outing! Easy for puppy to get used to. Walkers are a lifesaver to parents who love their 🐶 no need to give in the towel. With these big wheels he keeps up his strength and exercise. We have 2 others. It warms everyone's hearts when they see the pack walking together ❤
customer_reviews.author: Kim Martin

customer_reviews.title: The manufacturer paid a lot of attention to details.
customer_reviews.text: The first thing I noticed was the packaging. No peanuts or decomposing styrofoam were present. The chair pieces were all perfectly protected by custom cardboard partitions. That gave me confidence the chair itself would be well designed and built. It was. Our dog is still a little afraid of the device, but with only three days of trying, it’s too early to declare success or failure. Our dog uses it but still needs coaxing.
customer_reviews.author: R. Robertus

customer_reviews.title: helps with degenerative myelopathy
customer_reviews.text: This fit well on my 110 pound, xlarge german shepherd with degenerative myelopathy who normally can only walk a short distance before needing a rest. We're able to make it on a normal walk now and I can tell he has a greatly improved mood. I'd recommend boots when walking on pavement to avoid scrapes. The price seems high for what's in the box but otherwise i'm glad we got it.
customer_reviews.author: B. Sautner

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: My girl had a torn acl, and due to age and health issues can't have surgery. I was sceptical at first but it's you adjust correctly it works wonders. Ask the weight is distributed to the front legs and she can walk! It actually helps correct her trying to compensate with her good hind leg. Would recommend for senior dog with back leg issues.
customer_reviews.author: Bri

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to adjust
customer_reviews.text: It takes a bit of time to adjust the frame and straps around the dog. This is especially hard when you have a dog that cannot stand on its own for a period of time. There has to be an easier way.
customer_reviews.author: Peppercorn

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with this product!
customer_reviews.text: I'm very happy with this product . It's well made and very adjustable . I'm glad I picked this over the less adjustable models because some days I can make him support his weight for exercise more then others. It's also very easy to get the dog in and out of . I'm dealing with a big and stubborn German Shepard and can get him in it pretty quickly .
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Take time to fit it correctly and you will be amazed how quickly they adapt
customer_reviews.text: This is worth every penny!!!!! My GSD can now go out on walks with the other dogs. Take time to fit it correctly and you will be amazed how quickly they adapt. A quick note, keep your hand on the horizontal bar at all times when connecting and disconnecting to keep the wheels from moving which can cause the cart to upset backwards.
customer_reviews.author: Beth K.

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great product, but my dog was unable to use it. The return was torture
customer_reviews.author: Gladys

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: I just now started using it and the straps that hold her lower stomach seem to be too small, so stays really high and doesnt hold her back side comfortably.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's good to see him so mobile again
customer_reviews.text: Buddy loves it! He can "chase" trucks once again! (NO, we don't let him in the road! His wheelchair has a long cord attached so he can chase and my husband can control). He's learning how to maneuver in it and back up on his own to get around corners. It's good to see him so mobile again.
customer_reviews.author: Carol T.

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and easy to use, my dog loves it!
customer_reviews.text: This was easy to get my dog in to. He has myelopathy and his back legs give out on him often. I was afraid my dog would be hesitant to walk with it but once it was on him but he took to it with no problem. I could see his confidence as we took our first walk and he learned that he wasn’t going to fall. This was cheaper than another one I was looking at but I selected it due to other ratings and have not been disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Jennie

customer_reviews.title: Overall really happy but needs a better way for the back end to be strapped in.
customer_reviews.text: I think this photo says it all. My GS has dm so shes been slowly loosing her back leg. She doesnt run with the chair like the dogs in the videos, but she likes being outside on her slow walks again. Overall the chair is great but getting my dogs butt into it always ends up with one of us humans getting peed on. Lol. The walkin lift rear harness is easier for strapping her in in the chair... but when she pees (despite saying its designed for a dog to do their business) always ends up being peed in. I havent tried the rear front combo harness yet.
customer_reviews.author: P

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for our aging large dog.
customer_reviews.text: I wish I would have bought this two months earlier as we went through a lot of energy trying to complete a walk around the block with our lab/bloodhound who at 13 years has muscle atrophy. With these wheels he can go off road on short hikes and our walks around the community are completed with ease. He can poop and pee with the wheels attached and no mess on the apparatus. It was costly to purchase, but would highly recommend this brand. We no longer experience the pain of trying to lift our dog every few feet from his constant falls and he adapted to using the wheels without any difficulty.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I wish it was made better with stronger materials but it wokrs until you wear ...
customer_reviews.text: I wish it was made better with stronger materials but it wokrs until you wear it out which might happen faster than you think
customer_reviews.author: J. H. Minoff

customer_reviews.title: Poor return policy
customer_reviews.text: Seems like a good quality product for sure but 1) was not the color I ordered, 2) instructions were not that easy to follow for set up and placing the dog in the wheelchair, 3) dog didn't really take to it and now it's past the 30 day return so on no use. Guess I'll have to find a local rescue that may be able to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best Dog Wheelchair on the Market.
customer_reviews.text: Best Dog Wheelchair on the market, period! You and your pet will be satisfied with this product. Adjustment is easy with the push buttons and you don't have to lift your dogs butt over their heads to get them into it!!! There is a detachable strap that goes between your dogs legs that you can lift them with and snap into place on the wheelchair.
customer_reviews.author: Jim F.

customer_reviews.title: Great style! Great quality engineering
customer_reviews.text: Great style! Great quality engineering!!! Works great once dog gets accustomed to it.!! Worth every penny for a dog in need.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Rahn

customer_reviews.title: not worth $500
customer_reviews.text: before you buy this take into consideration your dog cannot sit. this is meant to take them out and about which I guess is cool; however, for the price, I would say I would not buy it again. I used it for a month. We then bought a 25 strap that goes under him and I just walk with him and he is so much happier.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy!
customer_reviews.text: My 14 year old enjoying his new found freedom!!!! Great product! 💕🐾
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Effective and invaluable product !!
customer_reviews.text: It gave my dog legs to walk around in the last couple months of his life. It was a tear jerking moment. Very EFFECTIVE product. I am not able to put a value on my “loyal and best friend” dog being able to walk. From the bottom of my heart, THANK YOU for making this wheel !!
customer_reviews.author: Misan

customer_reviews.title: It was very uncomfortable for my dog
customer_reviews.text: She could not sit lay down and wasn’t comfortable in it
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Tyson

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely love it!
customer_reviews.text: I have a 12 year old boxer/Dane mix named Dirk. He had DM and this chair gave him his youthfulness back! He can’t wait to go out everyday and can be playing in it for hours at the park. Super easy to use, adjust and assemble. Definitely recommend it to anyone in this situation.
customer_reviews.author: Brian B.

customer_reviews.title: in which my dog was getting super tired.
customer_reviews.text: Kind of difficult to adjust to my 85 pound dog. Took multiple tries... in which my dog was getting super tired... and so was I! Once we figured it out... it worked great.
customer_reviews.author: Ninna's Road to Rescue

customer_reviews.title: VERY HAPPY SHEPHERD
customer_reviews.text: Best decision made for my 90lb german shepherd. She was dragging herself around due to spinal cord deterioration. Shes has her life back!
customer_reviews.author: Karla Lang

customer_reviews.title: Have tried several times to fit and make comfortable for him even brought to the veterinarians office and ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought the wheelchair for my 180 lb Mastiff. He has osteosarcoma in his right hind leg and has not been on a walk due to the pain and weakness of cancer in months. Have tried several times to fit and make comfortable for him even brought to the veterinarians office and had several vet techs and the veterinarian try to no avail. Was really excited with the prospect of getting him out and on a walk but it's just too uncomfortable for him it pinches, squeezes and bindes
customer_reviews.author: Heidi

customer_reviews.title: I would not recommend this product
customer_reviews.text: My dog would not use this wheelchair; I followed all the instructions, had him in the chair but all he would do is either sit or fall over and whine. Parts of the wheelchair seemed flimsy and the harness that goes around the back legs was very uncomfortable for my dog. Because of their very limited return policy (14 days), I would not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Would recommend this to anyone who has a dog with limited ...
customer_reviews.text: I give this product 5 stars. It was everything we hoped for. We needed it for our Airedale Terrier, Pheobe, it took her just a short time to become proficient with it. We also got it within the time we were promised. Would recommend this to anyone who has a dog with limited mobility, it was a small price to pay for such a wonderful , life changing, product.
customer_reviews.author: Lloyd Shinholt

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Our dog Bella loves it! It workwd perfectly to allow her to walk with ease again.
customer_reviews.author: Don McCord

customer_reviews.title: This product is a lifesaver
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and just seeing the front harness has her excitedly struggling to rise and go for a walk. It brought the puppy out in her again.
customer_reviews.author: willard t mcintosh

customer_reviews.title: Helps my dog get needed exercise
customer_reviews.text: It was delivered very quickly. Easy enough to assemble. My dog is unable to walk because his back legs have given out. This helps him to get some exercise. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Janice Davenport

customer_reviews.title: more of an issue with my dog than an issue with the product.
customer_reviews.text: If you can get your dog to try, this product is for you. I waited too long when my dog had lost too much muscle, and he couldn't use it at all. Further, it is difficult to get him in and out of. It had to go back. Returning requires a restock fee, which is frusturating. You also pay return shipping, which is expensive. It cost me close to $100 in the end to return it. All told, it was worth the $100 to see if it could have given my old man more freedom. Unfortunately he refused to use it and I was out the $100.
customer_reviews.author: Windfall71

customer_reviews.title: the components allow too much play with the connections causing ...
customer_reviews.text: the components allow too much play with the connections causing it to "wiggle" as he uses it. For the cost of this item, I would of expected tightly secured connections for increased stability.
customer_reviews.author: Toni DiBartolomeo

customer_reviews.title: extremely pleased
customer_reviews.text: our dog Diesel figured out after a few steps he could walk again. his tail stared wagging non stop and he took off down the driveway for the first walk he has been able to go for a couple of months. we are are extremely pleased with it
customer_reviews.author: john d wahlquist

customer_reviews.title: On the road again!
customer_reviews.text: Even with the video it took me awhile to assemble the cart. After adjusting and training my dog it is wonderful. My dog is finally getting the hang of it. It has been about a month. My dog feels mobile again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wheels gave our dog an opportunity to stand outside without ...
customer_reviews.text: Wheels gave our dog an opportunity to stand and move outside without being held. However, after six weeks of using, he either cannot or will not consistently do his business while hooked in the chair.
customer_reviews.author: D. M.

customer_reviews.title: Very helpful
customer_reviews.text: Used this for my American bulldog... very helpful when she wasn't able to use her back legs
customer_reviews.author: Jolene

customer_reviews.title: Overall solid, color mistake
customer_reviews.text: I’m overall happy with the order however there was a mistake with the color. I ordered a blue version of the product and received a pink one.
customer_reviews.author: Marcus

customer_reviews.title: Think twice!
customer_reviews.text: Hard to set up, not really suitable for all dogs. Very poor customer service. Harsh 20% restocking fee.
customer_reviews.author: Caribefatboy

customer_reviews.title: Saved my boi!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing product, i wish i had more time to write about this product BIG THUMBS UP!
customer_reviews.author: Robert Gershman

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great service! The chair works as it is marketed and fulfilled my expectations! Thanks so much!
customer_reviews.author: Felipe robles

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use for me and light enough for my senior dog. Hope they have
customer_reviews.author: Yoko Shibata

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: The wheelchair has definitely helped our dog. After a few weeks he learned how to maneuver it quite well and since he is 65 lbs carrying him everywhere was not an option.
customer_reviews.author: Janice D.

customer_reviews.title: Our dog got worse real quick
customer_reviews.text: Our dog got worse real quick, so she only used it a few days. It seemed to hurt her rear end and legs to get her in it.
customer_reviews.author: Carol Miller

customer_reviews.title: Worth It.
customer_reviews.text: As soon as we put it on our Lab Shepherd mix he took off. Easy to adjust height, width, and length. Worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Robyn Edmondson

customer_reviews.title: It’s great
customer_reviews.text: Well built! works as advertised! Held out my dog was wondering if his time was up. Having a very hard time walking in his old age. Didn’t take him long to figure out how to use it. If there’s anything I could change was that I didn’t have to take the harness off every time. Would be nice if the harness can stay on the dog and clip him in and out but that’s easier said than done. Worth the price tag nonetheless
customer_reviews.author: Matt rice

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful
customer_reviews.text: Made well. Your pets may take a little time to get used it, but when they do it is priceless. You’ll get to spend more quality time with your pet.
customer_reviews.author: Debra

customer_reviews.title: Very well made
customer_reviews.text: This was fairly easy to assemble but does obviously require adjustment once you try it on your dog for size. Didn't get to use it as my fur-baby crossed the Rainbow Bridge before we were able to use it. Looks like it would have been great for her.
customer_reviews.author: Radio Junkie

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic Wheelchair for my 90 lb Pointer who was paralyzed. Easy to install and delivery was very fast. Ordered the Quad Wheelchair and was very pleased. Customer service was fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Carroll

customer_reviews.title: Don't settle for "cheaper" when you can have Walking Wheels.
customer_reviews.text: Makes caring for our paraplegic 100 lb. lab a breeze. Bought the hot pink racing stripes for our girl so she can still live up to her name: Reckless.
customer_reviews.author: J. Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Sassy
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality! Perfect for my German Shepard who’s hip s went out.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Its nice to be able to walk my German Shepherd, he loves it Great product and very portable
customer_reviews.author: E. Dumas

customer_reviews.title: Mobile Again!
customer_reviews.text: Walkin Wheels is a great aid for my elderly German Shepherd to get him mobile. He loves to wheel around to his favorite locations and be around the family.
customer_reviews.author: Laura L Dorame

customer_reviews.title: Easy to put together as long as you take proper ...
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put together as long as you take proper measurements. Works even better than expected, and our paraplegic German Shepherd loves going for walks in his wheels!
customer_reviews.author: Luke 2.

customer_reviews.title: Definitely Helpful
customer_reviews.text: Works great! Just wish I had ordered one size bigger.
customer_reviews.author: nditz

customer_reviews.title: Great dog cart
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves her cart. It is lightweight and portable. She is a 13yr old German Shepherd. The cart is easy to fit and adjust. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: G

product_meta.title: Walkin' Wheels Dog Wheelchair - for Large Dogs 70-180 Pounds - Veterinarian Approved - Dog Wheelchair for Back Legs
feature_bullets: CREATES A HAPPY, HEALTHY LIFE FOR PETS & PET PARENTS! - The Walkin’ Wheels dog wheelchair gives your best friend the happy, healthy life they deserve. Our pet wheelchair provides support for your dog’s back legs allowing them to run, play and enjoy quality time with the family.

KEEPS YOUR DOG MOBILE & COMFORTABLE - Nothing makes our pets, with limited to no mobility in their hind legs, feel loved more than being able to run, play, and explore with their family. Our wheelchair for dogs has a durable, lightweight aluminum frame that makes your dog mobile while also keeping them stable. Its dense foam wheels with rubber treads won’t puncture and they will allow your pet to explore all types of terrain.

EASY TO STORE, TRANSPORT, AND CLEAN - Our Medium to Large size dog wheelchairs fold flat making it easy to load into your car when your family travels or to conveniently store when not in use. Additionally, all of the pet wheelchair parts are washable including the foam/rubber wheels making it easy to clean.

PATENTED ADJUSTABLE DESIGN FOR THE PERFECT FIT - Walkin’ Wheels’ rear support dog wheelchairs feature our patented adjustable design making it the only dog wheel cart that can be tailored to your dog’s size and changing health. This wheelchair for dogs is also adjustable in height, length, and width ensuring that your pet is both mobile and comfortable throughout their life stages.

VETERINARIAN APPROVED - Many Veterinary professionals have spoken about the positive impact that the Walkin Wheels have had on their clients. By helping their patients stay mobile despite their limitations, these pet wheelchairs allow them to remain active and maintain a great quality of life. Our pet wheelchair provides support for dog’s hind legs making it suitable for injured or disabled pets as well as dogs with limited mobility due to age.
